name: Homemade Doner Kebab
description: Make a home version of spit-roasted lamb (doner) kebab, served as a sandwich with vegetables and sauce.

author.name: Anita Schecter
author.description: Professional recipe developer, food photographer, and blogger with more than a decade of experience creating Middle Eastern recipes.
knowsAbout: food photography, Middle Eastern food, home cooking

recipeIngredient: 1 pound ground lamb (or 1/2 pound each of ground lamb and ground beef)
1 tablespoon oil (for the skillet, plus extra for the pan)
4 rounds of pita (or naan or flatbread)

recipeInstructions.text: Pre heat the oven to 350 F. In a large bowl, combine the ground lamb, egg, garlic, ground cumin, ground coriander, smoked paprika, dried oregano, salt, and black pepper.
Place the mixture into an oiled 9 x 5-inch loaf pan and cook in the oven for approximately 30 minutes or until the top is a light golden brown.
You can slice the loaf immediately if you like but, for best results, cool completely, wrap in aluminum foil, and refrigerate until firm.
To reheat, add a little olive oil to a large skillet, slice the loaf very thinly and crisp up the slices in the hot pan for a few minutes.
Assemble the sandwiches with pita, warmed and toasted through. Spread on some tzatziki or tahini sauce, add lettuce, tomato, cucumber, onion, and top with more sauce.

video.name: How to Make the Best Doner Kebabs
video.description: The Doner Kebab is a Turkish combination of meat (often lamb) that is seasoned, stacked in a cone shape, and cooked slowly on a vertical rotisserie. In this video, we teach you how to make the delicious dish, using garlic, spices, pita, vegetables, Tzatziki or Tahini sauce. Great for lunch or dinner, this is one unforgettable, savory dish.
